results.title: TV subtitles
results.brief_description: Angry and frustrated when a hotel did not provide tv’s with tv suibtitles, Robert took matters into his own hands to fight for the rights of people with special needs. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Weekends in the country
results.brief_description: Born in the country but forced to live in a hostel for the deaf in Melbourne from a very young age, William talks about his isolation, depression and separation from family. This is a tragic story reflecting the lack of facilities and support for the deaf in rural Victoria. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: When deaf minds travel
results.brief_description: Much is written and discussed about the mental health challenges for the deaf community, but rarely do we hear from those directly dealing with these challenges. This project was produced in partnership with VicDeaf.

results.title: Signs of understanding
results.brief_description: Kris Chapman talks about the ACMI/Vicdeaf Project, its purpose and of the six deaf/hearing impaired people chosen to take part and contribute their stories and thoughts. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Flame within
results.brief_description: A silent film consisting of a montage of images of family, friends, childhood and home juxtaposed to the words passion, freedom and home - each word with its meaning defined in text.

results.title: Mamadrama
results.creator_credit: Monique Schwarz, Arte, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Amber Films
results.brief_description: An Australian documentary examining the portrayal of Jewish mothers on the big screen. From an early age filmmaker Monique Schwarz was puzzled by the discrepancy between the domineering and emasculating Jewish mothers typically represented on film, and her own mother, a Holocaust survivor. “Mamadrama” consequently has a strong personal touch, via the reflections of Schwarz and interviews with directors Paul Mazursky, Paul Bogart, and Larry Peerce, and actress Lainie Kazan. In addition to well-known Hollywood movies “Mamadrama” uses rare footage from early silent films, Yiddish language features and Israeli films. The tone of the documentary is reflective rather than critical; the most intriguing moments emerge from the candour with which the interviewees discuss their own mothers.

results.title: The Bowater story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Graham, World Wide Pictures and Bowater
results.brief_description: A story of industrial growth and enterprise - in 1926 the British company Bowater began making paper as well as selling it, and now owns mills and forests in many parts of the world including Norway, Sweden, USA, France, New Zealand and Australia.

results.title: The Heritage of the uncommon man
results.creator_credit: Reid H Ray and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Joe Powell, a noted lecturer to businessmen, expounds his notions of the “Uncommon man” - the man who gets results. In an entertaining lecture, Powell describes the attributes and behaviour of the successful executive. Uses cartoons to illustrate some points of the lecture.
